text: are you custom coding the columns or are you using HubSpot’s columns?

So question on how HubSpot tracks those who mark as spam. Basically how does this happen? According to the KB article:
>Spam reports: contacts who reported this email as spam to their email provider, or manually dragged the email from their inbox into their junk folder. These contacts will be dropped from future emails.
How can HS tell they they marked it as spam or even that they dragged it to their junk folder?
I'm genuinely curious about this. I know that there are spam scores in headers and all that jazz but how would they know this from the users end?
Does the ISP send something back to HS (or whoever) when its marked?

Tl;dr is that Google (and other ESPs) tell us through what is technically called a “FeedBack Loop”  For google specifically they have this <https://support.google.com/mail/answer/6254652?hl=en> that might interesting to read further
This is awesome, thank you Zack, we have client who wanted to know how to get them back and then a million questions were tossed to me on how it works. This is awesome.
